channel.title: [GFX] Anything related to GFX, tutorials, Showoff and the lot [GFX]
channel.description:
I realized there was no where else to release this on [b]Moparscape[/b] I'm going to release this here.
Feel free to release your work here and allow people to evaluate.
This is my latest work and really did feel the need to show it off :P
If anything the render is the leech. [img]http://i1233.photobucket.com/albums/ff382/michaelzzzzzz/FirstGo.png[/img]
Constructive Criticism please.

item.dc:creator: @chillwitm888 chillwitm888
item.description:
@chillwitm888 wrote:

[quote=“B2300 T4nk, post:85, topic:430574”][quote author=chillwitm888 link=topic=533250.msg3902201#msg3902201 date=1327867707]

^ Lol’d.

It actually depends on quality of the work, If you want REAL 1080p video plus adding more than 15 effects it can easily surpass a hour
now if you are using windows movie maker and making a crap 240p video with over 1000 frames it would only take a good 3 minutes
[/quote]You do know Quake 3 is a game made in 1999?[/quote]
yeah, i actually have it on my ipod…

item.title: [GFX] Anything related to GFX, tutorials, Showoff and the lot [GFX]
item.dc:creator: @Junkeh Junkeh
item.description:
@Junkeh wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:79, topic:430574”][quote author=Junkeh link=topic=533250.msg3902126#msg3902126 date=1327861108]

How does rendering a 6 second intro take 3 hours, my god are you working with an either a gig of memory or something?

Considering there’s around 30~ frames per second in an average video clip, multiply 30 by 6 and you get a total of 180 frames, each of which has to be rendered individually, considering he’s probably using global illumination and other high quality render techniques, I’d say 3 hours is pretty good, coming from someone who also renders on the same computer I play battlefield 3 on…

Thanks for backing me up, they have no idea what they are even talking about. They just assume that my computer is slow, when they have no idea what it is actually doing and how slow the process is.

Try rendering 180 images in less than 3 hours, that is basically what it’s doing.

That is correct, by the way is your cpu higher than 2.7? and is atleast triple core?
Try this experiment on a highly rated video program like sony vegas or premiere on one 5 second clip, try adding 15 effects or more and
try rendering it ill bet it will take atleast a good few hours

Nope, here is my sepcs: http://www.shopping.hp.com/webapp/shopping/product_detail.do?landing=outlet&storeName=storefronts&category=laptop&lanAttr=column1&lanAttr=&catLevel=2&product_code=QD978UA%23ABA
[/quote]
Ooh sweet, my laptop is just slightly higher spec than that I use her for rendering and gaming.[/quote]
It’s easily my favorite lappy. Especially because it has Beats Audio.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“Junkeh, post:78, topic:430574”][quote author=chillwitm888 link=topic=533250.msg3902125#msg3902125 date=1327860906]

How does rendering a 6 second intro take 3 hours, my god are you working with an either a gig of memory or something?

Considering there’s around 30~ frames per second in an average video clip, multiply 30 by 6 and you get a total of 180 frames, each of which has to be rendered individually, considering he’s probably using global illumination and other high quality render techniques, I’d say 3 hours is pretty good, coming from someone who also renders on the same computer I play battlefield 3 on…

Thanks for backing me up, they have no idea what they are even talking about. They just assume that my computer is slow, when they have no idea what it is actually doing and how slow the process is.

Try rendering 180 images in less than 3 hours, that is basically what it’s doing.

That is correct, by the way is your cpu higher than 2.7? and is atleast triple core?
Try this experiment on a highly rated video program like sony vegas or premiere on one 5 second clip, try adding 15 effects or more and
try rendering it ill bet it will take atleast a good few hours
[/quote]

Nope, here is my sepcs: http://www.shopping.hp.com/webapp/shopping/product_detail.do?landing=outlet&storeName=storefronts&category=laptop&lanAttr=column1&lanAttr=&catLevel=2&product_code=QD978UA%23ABA[/quote]
Ooh sweet, my laptop is just slightly higher spec than that I use her for rendering and gaming.

item.title: [GFX] Anything related to GFX, tutorials, Showoff and the lot [GFX]
item.dc:creator: @Junkeh Junkeh
item.description:
@Junkeh wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:75, topic:430574”][quote author=Andrew Ferguson link=topic=533250.msg3902072#msg3902072 date=1327858204]
How does rendering a 6 second intro take 3 hours, my god are you working with an either a gig of memory or something?
[/quote]
Considering there’s around 30~ frames per second in an average video clip, multiply 30 by 6 and you get a total of 180 frames, each of which has to be rendered individually, considering he’s probably using global illumination and other high quality render techniques, I’d say 3 hours is pretty good, coming from someone who also renders on the same computer I play battlefield 3 on…[/quote]

Thanks for backing me up, they have no idea what they are even talking about. They just assume that my computer is slow, when they have no idea what it is actually doing and how slow the process is.

Try rendering 180 images in less than 3 hours, that is basically what it’s doing.

Read full topic
item.source: [GFX] Anything related to GFX, tutorials, Showoff and the lot [GFX]

item.title: [GFX] Anything related to GFX, tutorials, Showoff and the lot [GFX]
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Andrew Ferguson:

How does rendering a 6 second intro take 3 hours, my god are you working with an either a gig of memory or something?

Considering there’s around 30~ frames per second in an average video clip, multiply 30 by 6 and you get a total of 180 frames, each of which has to be rendered individually and stitched together (often automated), considering he’s probably using global illumination and other high quality render techniques, I’d say 3 hours is pretty good, coming from someone who also renders on the same computer I play battlefield 3 on…

Read full topic
item.source: [GFX] Anything related to GFX, tutorials, Showoff and the lot [GFX]

item.title: [GFX] Anything related to GFX, tutorials, Showoff and the lot [GFX]

item.description:
@B2300_T4nk wrote:

[quote=“Andrew Ferguson, post:72, topic:430574”]How does rendering a 6 second intro take 3 hours, my god are you working with an either a gig of memory or something?[/quote]finally, somebody that is smart.

Read full topic
item.source: [GFX] Anything related to GFX, tutorials, Showoff and the lot [GFX]

item.title: [GFX] Anything related to GFX, tutorials, Showoff and the lot [GFX]
item.dc:creator: @Junkeh Junkeh
item.description:
@Junkeh wrote:

Andrew Ferguson:

How does rendering a 6 second intro take 3 hours, my god are you working with an either a gig of memory or something?

No, it has to render every single frame. And usually the frame has lots of effects and other stuff that the person added. 1 Frame = ABOUT 1 minutes, so when you have a 6 second video with 160 frames, it’s going to take a while.

Read full topic
item.source: [GFX] Anything related to GFX, tutorials, Showoff and the lot [GFX]
